channel.title: Radial road walk
channel.description: can someone explain how to use radialroadwalk? Like, whats a startradial and an endradial and the x/ymods Thanks

item.title: Radial road walk
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

[quote=“omgh4x0rz, post:5, topic:3440”]thanks. another question bout SRL.
I was trying to use the antiban thing ‘RotateEvery’, but I get
Line 37: [Error] (4833:6): Unknown identifier ‘TimeFromMark’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl/srl/core/AntiBan.scar[/quote]

Sorry you need SRL\SRL.sCAR included because it has all the variables and timers for Antiban.Scar you have to include the whole SRL include for it to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Radial road walk
item.dc:creator: @omgh4x0rz omgh4x0rz
item.description:
@omgh4x0rz wrote:

thanks. another question bout SRL.
I was trying to use the antiban thing ‘RotateEvery’, but I get
Line 37: [Error] (4833:6): Unknown identifier ‘TimeFromMark’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl/srl/core/AntiBan.scar

program natthief;
{.include squig2.txt}
{.include srl/srl/core/AntiBan.scar}
var
x,y,c,mins:integer;

const
chest=3754080;

procedure thieve;
begin
findcolortolerance(x,y,chest,200,126,301,294,2);
movemousesmoothex(x,y,40,50,60,40,40);
wait(200);
ClickHuman(x,y,false);
wait(1000);
ClickText(‘traps’,s1,s2,s3,s4,true);
end;

begin
c:=0
setupsquig(‘Limewire-Enabling File Sharing’)
setupSRL;
activateclient;
repeat
thieve;
RotateEvery(5);
until(c=500)
end.

Read full topic

item.title: Radial road walk
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

Ill tell you the Basics and ill ask Fawki to post his tut here maybe he will maybe he won’t donnu. Basicly RadialWalk is a Walker that can find colors ClockWise and CounterClockwise so therefore it is quite powerful. the Basic Radials are

0 --> North
90 --> East
180 --> South
270 --> West

Those are your basic Start and End Radials or Numbers in between as it goes from 0-360 around the compass, Now the Distance part ( the last radial number to integer) is the Distance from the MiniMap Center so 10 will be very close to the Center and 60-70 will be at the end of the Map, basicly this will search the area from the Start Radial say 0 or North to say the End Radial 90 of East so it will Search from North to East in a clockwise manner, yet if your Start is 90 and your End is 0 it will search Counterclockwise from East to North.

Hope that helps.

-Dankness
SRL Admin

Read full topic
